Case reference: 2006018499.CaseDesc: Tony Gikoff was last seen July 9, 1955, near Colborne, Ontario, at a property he rented to tenants. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008009698.CaseDesc: Richard Rusholme was last seen when he left his residence.  He was preparing to leave with a friend to look for work out West and had already packed his bags. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019003520.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2019, Addrienne McRobert was seen for the last time leaving the residence of a friend in Oshawa, Ontario.

Coat: Black, Hooded, "BENCH" written vertically on the back
Tattoo: Left Thigh, Text: Forever & Always & Derek

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014006315.CaseDesc: Julia STROBACH was last seen in her residence on Braidwood Road in Courtenay, British Columbia on October 31st, 2013 in the early evening hours.  Unfortunately, after a lengthy and comprehensive investigation police have been unable to find any trace of Julia.  Police along with Julia’s friends and family are gravely concerned for Julia's wellbeing as she has been out of contact for a year now.  It is completely out of character for Julia to be out of contact with her friends and family for so long, especially with her 3 year old son.  Police are appealing to anyone with information about Julia's movements and activities in the days and weeks leading up to October 31st, 2013, to get in touch with investigators immediately.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Long, Often dyed red

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2014004770.CaseDesc: At approximately 11:00 p.m. on April 17, 2006, Sangeeta Khanna called a family member and told him that she was going to stop at the bank and then would be home shortly. In the morning when she did not arrive the police were called. Her vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot in Edmonton and she has not been seen since. The investigation is ongoing and investigators believe that Sangeeta may be the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2013000007.CaseDesc: Kimberly Ann McAndrew has been missing since August 12, 1989. At 4:20 p.m., she left the Canadian Tire where she was employed as a cashier. There were unconfirmed reports that Kimberly was last seen at the Gardenia Flower Shop in Penhorn Mall in Dartmouth. She was identified by an employee at the flower shop as having bought a balloon and a rose.

Shoes: Jade green, flat heeled slip on loafers

Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2021022554.CaseDesc: Muoi Nguyen was last seen on January 5, 1990 and was reported missing on January 12, 1990. Police have not been able to locate Muoi NGUYEN.

Case reference: 2014003988.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1989, Gordon Clark was last seen at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.  He had an argument with his common law wife who left the residence and when she returned home, he was gone.  Gordon has not been heard from or seen by any family members or friends since.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003814.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1980, Leon Kitchekesik and his parents were staying at their cabin on Gull Lake. Leon was walking along the shore with his three year old sister. The parents went to investigate when they heard the screams of their daughter. The parents located footprints approaching a small hole and none leading away from the hole. There was a land search conducted however it is felt the boy drowned.

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2014004404.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1993, Sidiki Camara was reported missing by air traffic control after disappearing from the radar while flying to Prince Edward Island from the Moncton Airport. Sidiki's plane was last recorded descending at a high rate of speed. Only a few parts of the plane were found during a search of the crash location.

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario, after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  At the time of his disappearance, Ben suffered from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, Often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, Winter coat with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014040212.CaseDesc: On October 24, 1991, Terry Patrick was seen for the last time at a motel in Pueblo, Colorado, USA. Terry was scheduled to go on a hunting trip with his friend on November 4, 1991, but never showed up.

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date James has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2000000830.CaseDesc: Charlene was last seen hitch-hiking at the intersection of Hwy 3 and the Rae Access Road.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2023044188.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2023, Kevin Evoy was last seen leaving the Giant Tiger store in Clarence-Rockland, Ontario. He has epilepsy, no cell phone, no social media, and no other form of communication. Since Kevin rarely leaves the home, his family is concerned that he may have suffered a medical issue.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Very faded peacock tattoo

Case reference: 2014005202.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2008, Ani Ashekian last contacted her family. During the time of her disappearance, Ani, a world traveller, was vacationing in Hong Kong, China, with two friends. At some point during her trip, Ani checked out of her hotel room, and made two cash withdrawals from a ATM.

Case reference: 2012020062.CaseDesc: On July 15, 2000 Marcus McKay went hunting with his step father and three others.  Marcus and his step father broke apart from the group to hunt on their own. Some time later, the pair successfully felled a deer. Marcus was to stay with the deer while his step father went to get help from their friends. When his stepfather returned Marcus was no where to be found. He was last seen 10 km north of Mallard and Bison Road.

Case reference: 2022001264.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2022, Ian Indridson was seen for the last time at his residence in Victoria, British Columbia.  Ian has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Blue, Eddie Bauer Brand, waffle knit, black or blue

Case reference: 2014004096.CaseDesc: On June 19, 1990, at approximately 4:00pm, Elizabeth Bain was seen for the last time leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Elizabeth was seen leaving in her 1981 Toyota Tercel and was heading to the Scarborough Campus of the University of Toronto. On June 22, her vehicle was found abandon near the University’s campus.

Blouse: Other, BUTTON-UP, Button-up; floral pattern; polyester

Case reference: 2022064778.CaseDesc: Justin McMillan was last seen at his home in Keswick Ridge, New Brunswick, on December 19th, 2022. Law enforcement has explored numerous avenues to locate Justin with no success.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Puffy style winter jacket
Tattoo: Left Eye, Tear drop and cross

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Lee. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed that it swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Marcel was never found.

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2014006708.CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2014005607.CaseDesc: Eleanor Eatha Parkinson-Jenkins was last seen on Monday March 1, 1982. At that time, she was living in Saint-Bruno-de Montarville. She was reported missing by her family. Ms. Parkinson-Jenkins had been ill for the past six months. She would normally leave a note when she left, but not that morning. She usually spent her days in bed or never went out alone. She would have left after the departure of her husband and did not take her purse with her. She left on foot and never came back. She is a originally from Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (born Tyo) was last seen leaving the Lincoln Motor Hotel on McPhillips Street in Winnipeg, Manitoba on the morning of 25 July 2008.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, Bottom 12" dyed blonde

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2023013736.CaseDesc: On July 13, 2022, Magdalene Oerlemans was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. At the time of her disappearance, Magdalene was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006021099.CaseDesc: Roy Britten was last seen in a 14-foot aluminum boat in the Birch Beach area heading toward the northeast part of Caribou Island, Lake Superior, Ontario.  He is presumed drowned.

Jacket: Blue, Thunder Bay Police Force Association

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along the bank of the Ottawa river in Gatineau, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2021037317.CaseDesc: On 18 August, 2021, Kari Campbell was seen for the last time in the Durham Bridge region of York County, New Brunswick. Kari has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019042986.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1987, at approximately 8:15am, Anna Lippert was last seen at the Etobicoke General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Hair: Black, White, Straight, Short, Grey/black, messy; Beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, Irregular, broken/missing lower and upper  - decayed

Case reference: 2012020123.CaseDesc: Paul Côté left his residence on June 13th 2000 and hasn’t been seen since. His car was located a few days later, on June 18th 2000, in a commercial parking lot in the city of Rimouski.

Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2014003550.CaseDesc: Kenneth James Schmit, who went by "Jimmy", was last seen leaving a social gathering at a home in St. Walburg, Saskatchewan at 10:30 p.m. on September 22, 1966. Kenneth was feeling despondent, and, at the time of his disappearance, he sported a heavy beard. Numerous searches of the area were conducted, however, he was not located.

Case reference: 2013000142.CaseDesc: Richard Dryland was known to be homeless in the Grande Prairie, Alberta area. Mr. Dryland lived a transient lifestyle and often travelled to BC. In November 1993, he was released from the Peace River Correctional Centre. His family has not heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Heart and dagger

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005251.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2009, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Fabio Dapello was seen for the last time by his father as he left to go to work. When Fabio’s father returned home, both he and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014005794.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2012 at 11 p.m., Pierre Desjardins left his residence in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Quebec on foot and has not been seen since. Pierre was known to live a transient lifestyle and had made suicidal comments in the past.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Castle with a dragon on the bicep

Case reference: 2014006534.CaseDesc: In May of 1967, Donald Lariviere was seen for the last time at the Pinehouse airstrip in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Donald was accompanied by his father, who was sleeping at this time. When his father awakened, Donald was gone.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014002711.CaseDesc: Sharel Haresym was reported missing September 6, 1984, he was last seen was on September 4, 1984. Mr. Haresym's vehicle was located parked on the entrance road to Twin Lakes campground near Winfield, Alberta. The vehicle was out of fuel and also had a dead battery. Mr. Haresym's clothing was located approximately 100 yards east of his vehicle. His clothing was laid out in a neat and orderly fashion with his bible alongside.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat

Case reference: 2014006547.CaseDesc: Gregory Caesar was last seen near Watson Lake, Yukon Territory, in October, 2009. He was hitchhiking along the Alaska Highway and was believed to be heading to the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia.

Case reference: 2024017230.CaseDesc: Warren Dean left his residence in North Tonawanda at approximately 10:30 am on May 30, 1990. Warren was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, NY.  At that time Warren was believed to be despondent.

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: On March 15, 1989, Leona Brule was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. During the time of her disappearance, Leona was leading a high-risk, and transient lifestyle. She may have spent sometime in Edmonton, Alberta and Florida, USA.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2018041450.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1999, Fakhri Daoud was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Fakhri had returned to his residence to gather some money, his passport, and some of his personal belongings. The day before, he had purchased a one-way flight ticket to Aman, Jordan.

Case reference: 2021015408.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2021, Ziyue "Moses" LIU was reported missing from his family home in Surrey, British Columbia. On April 19, 2021, Moses was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia. He may or may not be wearing glasses.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles, slip on

Case reference: 2023054349.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2023, Kyrylo Yeltsov was reported missing from the IUSMM - Pavillon Bédard in the Mercier-Hochelaga-Maisonneuve District of Montréal, Québec. He hasn't spoken to his mother or any of his friends since, and he's never returned to the hospital. Kyrylo is originally from Ukraine and was feeling despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Bald, Black hair, currently bald

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2024006090.CaseDesc: Beverly Musick was seen for the last time in the area of the Seneca Casino in Niagara Falls, New York, USA on June 8, 2004.  The next morning, her personal belongings were located on Luna Island, NY. At the time of her disappearance, Beverly was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.
